intro: Cryptolepis reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined cryptolepis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and palmate leaves with a distinct network of veins. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported antimalarial and antimicrobial properties. Cryptolepis reticulata is also noted for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to dry conditions.
